thread.title: PayPal billionaire and Donald Trump adviser Peter Thiel's secret New Zealand citizenship sparks backlash
thread.title_full: PayPal billionaire and Donald Trump adviser Peter Thiel's secret New Zealand citizenship sparks backlash

author: Jonathan Pearlman
title: PayPal billionaire and Donald Trump adviser Peter Thiel's secret New Zealand citizenship sparks backlash
text:
PayPal billionaire and Donald Trump adviser Peter Thiel's secret New Zealand citizenship sparks backlash Peter Thiel speaks during the final day of the Republican National Convention in Cleveland Credit: AP Photo Jonathan Pearlman , Sydney  57am 
A secret deal to grant New Zealand citizenship to technology billionaire and Donald Trump supporter Peter Thiel has caused a political scandal as it emerged he failed to meet the usual requirements but donated $NZ1 million to the relief effort after the devastating 2011 earthquake in Christchurch. 
Mr Thiel, the co-founder of PayPal, received citizenship at a ceremony in California in 2011 after New Zealand’s government waived the usual requirements and resorted to an “exceptional circumstances” clause. 
Following public pressure, New Zealand’s government on Wednesday released 145 pages of documents revealing details of the deal. 
In one letter, Mr Thiel claimed it would "give him great pride to let it be known that he is a New Zealand citizen" – but he subsequently kept his citizenship secret and has never discussed it publicly. He has reportedly visited the country only four times and made clear in his application that he did not intend to live there. 
“I am happy to say categorically that I have found no other country that aligns more with my view of the future than New Zealand,” he wrote. PayPal founder Peter Thiel, right, listens as then President-elect Donald Trump speaks during a meeting with technology industry leaders at Trump Tower in New York Credit: Evan Vucci/AP 
B ut the government granted him citizenship on the basis of factors such as his entrepreneurial skills and his philanthropic largesse. This included his donation to the relief effort after the deadly 2011 quake. 
Mr Thiel, a German-born United States citizen, broke with many of his technology mogul counterparts by staunchly supporting Mr Trump. He donated more than $US1 million to Mr Trump’s campaign and is now an adviser to the new President. 
It is not precisely clear why Mr Thiel sought citizenship in New Zealand. Some have speculated that he was seeking a doomsday refuge in the event of catastrophe or mass unrest. 
Details of his new nationality emerged after local media discovered that he had bought a 193-hectare waterfront estate on Lake Wanaka, near Queenstown. Watch | Thiel Joins Trump Transition Team: What Will His Role Be? 03:05 
The government documents show Mr Thiel was made a citizen at a private ceremony at the New Zealand consulate in Santa Monica in August 2011. 
T he government recommended he be given citizenship despite his admission that he would not live in the country. 
"Given the investment Mr Thiel has made in New Zealand companies and the support and contacts he is able to provide, the Department is of the view that granting Mr Thiel's citizenship would be in the public interest due to his exceptional circumstances," the department of internal affairs concluded. 
The opposition has attacked the move and urged the government to explain exactly why it waived the usual citizenship requirements. Watch | What's Behind Peter Thiel's Support for Donald Trump? 03:58
